summary.para: Specifies the priority hint for a file I/O operation.

remarks.para: The function can be used with this structure to associate a priority hint with I/O operations on a file-handle basis. In addition to the idle priority (very low), this function allows normal priority and low priority. Whether these priorities are supported and honored by the underlying drivers depends on their implementation (which is why they are called hints). For more information, see the I/O Prioritization in Windows Vista
white paper on the Windows Hardware Developer Central (WHDC) website.
This structure must be aligned on a LONGLONG (8-byte) boundary.

summary.para: The priority hint. This member is a value from the enumeration.
